intro: Brachyscome trachycarpa, commonly known as the rough-seeded bluebell, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, blue or purple flowers arranged in a cluster. The plant has hairy, rough-textured leaves and stems, which give it its common name. It typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Brachyscome trachycarpa is a hardy perennial that thrives in full sun and is popular in native gardens.
